dialogue: Got a couple extras back at headquarters. If you’re interested, I could swear you in and get you a relic gun of your own.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Save it. I kill magical creatures. Not trying to be one.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh-huh. Well, I think we’ve gotten all the intelligence we’re going to get out of this place.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Maybe we should team up. We all hate monsters. I know the city…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Let me guess. You don’t wanna die alone in here?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What kind of coward do you take me for?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Through Vayne’s tough façade, you can hear the faintest tinge of fear in her voice.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You can come along. But you should know we’re only going deeper into danger.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We need to find the heart of this Harrowing.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s where the worst of this stuff is happening. It’s almost like it’s all flowing toward the building.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: It’s where the mageseekers keep the magical items they confiscate.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sounds like Viego’s looking for something magical. And powerful.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Just like what he took from me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t like that look in your eye. Maybe you going into the heart of this ain’t the best way to—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s head out, sentinels. On my count.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With your sentinel comrades at your side, you charge out the door of the tavern, into the fray of the Harrowing.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Just messing with you, Rookie. No one’s gonna hurt you.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...Unless you’re a monster. You’re not a monster are you?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Like I said, no one’s gonna hurt you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels arrive at the mageseeker compound. Black Mist pours into every door and window of the complex.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This is it. Whatever Viego is looking for, it’s within those walls.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Brace yourselves. We don’t know exactly what we’re walking into.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, keep your hand on that Wayfinder. But don’t trigger it unless I say so. Got it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Everybody on board? On my count, we charge in. Ready?

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Sentinels! Why… Why have you come here?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re here to end the Harrowing and liberate Demacia from the Black Mist. Who are you?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Be careful with this one, Senna. She’s more monstrous than she appears.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Yes. Monstrous… The reason for all the suffering. Pain inflicted by my own kingdom.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: So many have suffered here, for so long. Simply for being different.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Perhaps it is best if this place is harrowed to its core. Perhaps a ruined Demacia would be an improvement.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my! Her hue is changing! To a most unbecoming shade of green.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s becoming ruined. She’s giving in to the Mist!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Say the word, and I’ll put one right between her eyes.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: More threats... They fear us. They threaten and maim...

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: They banish us. Keep us in cages…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Shyvana shakes the surrounding walls of the mageseeker compound. Heavy pieces of petricite brick begin to fall.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my! This is most impolite!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Within seconds, you and the other sentinels are buried in rubble.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Get these rocks off me and I’ll be better. I can’t move. Rookie, you with us?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen’s scissors hover freely in the air, awaiting her command.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: See if you can cut us out of here!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Snip snip! Away with these dusty old bricks!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen’s scissors begin snipping away at the rubble.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Piece by piece, the rubble disappears, until the sentinels are free.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nice chopping, Scissors. You wield a mean pair of blades.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Where’s the beast woman? I’ve got a score to settle.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Save that anger. You’re going to need it for whatever’s inside this building.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You need me to slap this kid?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It ain’t just Demacia, Rookie. We let this place fall, we let the world fall.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Harrowing begets Harrowing. Noxus, the Freljord, Ionia… Wherever the hell it is you come from—they’ll all fall to the Ruined King.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s it. I’m slapping that kid. As soon as I get my arm free.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Vayne, do not slap our rookie.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie, remember what you signed up for. Sentinels run toward the Harrowing. We don’t hide from it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Hot on Viego’s trail, the sentinels arrive in Noxus. Before them, the Reckoners' Arena awaits, shrouded in Black Mist.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, confound it. It seems there’s no sentinel base here either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It’s here. It’s just been paved over.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Must be somewhere underneath this gladiatorial arena.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So they built a monument to bloodshed on top of a sacred bastion of light. Wow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As you approach the arena gates, you can hear the roar of a lively—and bloodthirsty—crowd.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Huh. Sounds like the arena’s full.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Even in the middle of a Harrowing, these people still make time for bloodsport. Wow again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels enter the arena floor to behold a startling sight…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A Noxian man, clad in shoddy armor, attempts to fight a swarm of wraiths.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What kind of fight is this? One poor grunt taking on a pack of wraiths? Not exactly sporting.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aye! Whatever happened to a wholesome one-on-one bludgeoning between well-matched participants?! This combat is NOT GLORIOUS!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though the gladiator gives it his all, the wraiths quickly overwhelm him.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The man’s lifeless body falls to the ground, joining countless others. In the stands, thousands of ghostly spectators roar with approval.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What kind of degenerate is running this spectacle?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a spectator’s box, at the far end of the arena, a figure stands.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From this distance, you can just barely make out the twin axes that twirl in his hands.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: What do ya say, folks?! WAS THAT NOT A FIGHT FOR THE AGES?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd cheers again, though its energy seems to be waning.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (Do they think this is easy? They have no idea how hard it is to make quality matches…)

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (...How much blood and sweat I’ve spilled to put together this spectacle. For their entertainment.)

speaker: Draven
dialogue: They should be CHEERING MY NAME!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I can still save this show. I just need more combatants! There must be more somewhere.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yep. Legendary maniac of the Reckoners’ Arena. Is it just me, or does he seem extra maniacal these days?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like the Mist has got him. And everybody else in this place.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But our fight’s not here. Viego wants something from Noxus. We need to find what his Mist is searching for—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From behind, you hear the closing of a metal portcullis.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: We-ellll… LADIES AND GENTLEMEN… It seems we have MORE COMBATANTS in DRAVEN’S BIG SHOW!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the crowd in the surrounding stands erupts in cheers of bloodlust, sending a chill down your spine.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: All these people are screaming. Shall I join them? Oh, please say yes!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like he just made us his main event.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But we came here to fight the Harrowing. And this has Harrowing written all over it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf and the sentinels chase Vex to the bottom of the glacier.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Cease your running, shadow lord! And give Olaf the grueling fight he yearns for!

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Nah. I think I’m done here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Magical artifact in hand, Vex continues her escape, heading for an icy pass between the mountains.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, dear. That dreadfully joyless fairy is escaping!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: And she’s still holding that shimmery trinket from the glacier. What on earth could she want with it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whatever it is, it’s not good. STOP THAT YORDLE!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex remains several yards ahead of you, as her shadow whisks her across the ice at surprising speed.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re not gaining any ground. Gotta try to cut off her escape.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This mountain pass looks like her only way out.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes. And if the snow on these mountains were to fall into that pass, she’d have no way out!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You want us to cause an avalanche? Isn’t that dangerous?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Of course it’s dangerous! But it’ll stop her, won’t it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay. Never thought I’d say these words, but…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Everyone help me figure out how to start an avalanche.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You soon hear the unmistakable rumble of snow shifting on the mountainside.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Heaps of snow begin sliding off the mountain, into the pass.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In seconds, the mountain pass fills with a mass of snow and ice, blocking Vex’s retreat.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hand over the trinket. It’s all we want.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That, and stop helping Viego in his insane plan to ruin the world.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You guys are the worst. And I know I say that about everyone, but this time it’s true.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You’ve actually turned me from indifferent to… slightly miffed.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: And you really don’t wanna see a teenage yordle miffed.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex’s posture stiffens, ever so slightly, as she summons a large shadow beneath the sentinels’ feet.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Inside the shadow, the sentinels’ movements and speech are dramatically slowed.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What… is this? I can barely… move.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels rush toward Vex, but their feet move at a snail’s pace.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [By the time they arrive where Vex was standing, she is long gone.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the distance, you can just barely see Vex and her shadow disappearing into a stream of Black Mist. The shadow beneath you dissipates.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: NOOOOOOOO! My heroic ending… It’s gone!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. So is that magical trinket.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I’m doomed to live. And to die the worst death of all… death from OLD AGE!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. I might know a way you can fix that.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian… I hope you’re not about to suggest what I think you are.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Why not? You’ve seen this fella in action. You tellin’ me you wouldn’t want his fury on the front line, chopping up the Harrowing?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie, back me up on this.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t know, Lucian. If you think we can trust this guy… I guess we can try him out.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Well, out with it then. Olaf hates hearin’ whispers behind his back.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Olaf, what if I told you we’re on a mission to fight the most worthy foe in all Runeterra?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I’d say point me in this foe’s direction! We’ll see how worthy they are!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, if anyone can give you a hero’s death, it’s this guy.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That idea might not be as dumb as it sounds. Good thinking, kid. (For once.)

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes. Olaf’s battle roar will part snow from rock, filling this valley with the frosts of many ages!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh! I’ve always wanted to try screaming. It seems like ever so much fun!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Everyone yell as loud as you can on my count. One… two…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You want to use our powerful, ancient relic guns… to shoot a mountain?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So that it’ll dump a bunch of snow?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It ain’t exactly sophisticated. But I like it.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well then... Let’s show this mountain who’s boss.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The valley’s illuminated with flashes of gunlight as the sentinels fire their weapons at the nearby mountainside.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Glad you think so. You can babysit ‘em from now on.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Guess they don’t teach good judgment during training.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: They teach survival. And more sentinels means more chance of that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You, Senna, and Riven enter an arena packed with ruined Noxians. Draven enters through the opposing gate.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Helloooooo, violence fans! ARE. YOU. READY?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven basks in the thunderous applause of the crowd.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: We’ve got a real bloodbath in store for ya today… starring yours truly… DRRRAVENNNN!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: And my opponents, fighting for the right to leave Noxus alive:

speaker: Draven
dialogue: LADY BIG GUNS!... RIVEN, THE FILTHY, TURNCOAT TRAITOR!... and… SOME KID!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: At least he didn’t call you traitor.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Draven, stop this madness! Call off the fight, or Noxus will fall to the Harrowing!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Hmm… I’ve considered your plea, and I have to say...

speaker: Draven
dialogue: NAHHHH! LET’S GET THIS VIOLENCE UNDERWAY!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls an axe at Senna’s head, abruptly starting the fight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna reacts quickly, shooting the axe away with her gun.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Cheap move. Now I’ve gotta hurt you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna opens fire on Draven, but he rolls out of the way with surprising agility, evading her shot.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I’ve still got ONE AXE LEFT, FIGHT FANS! WHAT AM I GONNA DO WITH IT?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls his axe at Senna’s gun. It lodges in the barrel, disabling the weapon.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Damn. Riven, Rookie—close in while he’s out of axes!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven and you sprint toward the unarmed Draven.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Ready, Rookie? Let’s cut him down!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You leap onto Draven’s back, attempting to strangle him from behind, while Riven charges from the front.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd loves it, much to your surprise… and Draven’s surprise.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He throws you over his shoulder, right into Riven. Then he turns to the crowd with disgust.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (Gotta get ‘em back. Can’t let some out-of-town mudheels steal my shine!)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven and you rush toward Draven once more. As you draw near, you see his eyes sparkle with a sly glint, and his hand reaching behind his back.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: What’s this, folks? It seems Draven is REACHING FOR SOMETHING IN HIS BELT…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls both axes in quick succession—one at you, and one at Riven.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven bats hers away with her sword. You are not so lucky.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna rushes to your side. You feel a warm trickle of blood flowing from your shoulder.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Well, folks—it looks like SOME KID is down! That axe in the shoulder really seems to have taken the wind right out of their sails!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd roars with excitement. Draven eats up that approval, savoring every last cheer.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Will the kid get back up? Or will the champ FINISH ‘EM OFF?!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Let’s go! Charge him before he comes back!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Or we stand in front and let him attack.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No he won’t. He’s milking the applause.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: When he attacks again, we take a dive. And wait for an opportunity.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven draws two more axes from his belt, and draws his arm back to hurl one.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I hope you’re right about this, Senna.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven throws the axes at Senna and Riven. Though they deflect the axes at the last possible moment, they fall to the ground, pretending to be gravely injured.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Right in the throat. Down I go.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Oh, no, violence fans! It seems Draven’s opponents are all DOWN FOR THE COUNT. It’s all over but the cryin’!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Whaddya say?! Should I FINISH THEM OFF?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd gives its loudest, most bloodthirsty scream of the night, but Draven still wants more. He turns his back on his fallen opponents to face the crowd.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Ah, ladies and gentlemen, that was TERRIBLE! I said—SHOULD I FINISH THEM OFF?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With Draven absorbed by the crowd, Senna and Riven tackle him to the ground and hogtie him with his arms behind his back.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: WHAAAT’S THIS, FIGHT FANS?! DRAVEN HAS BEEN AMBUSHED BY HIS LOW-DOWN, UNSCRUPULOUS OPPONENTS!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: For now, Big Guns. But when the champ goes down, there’s always a grudge match— H-HEY! WAIT! WHERE ARE YOU GOING?! SOMEBODY UNTIE DRAVEN!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd gives you all a standing ovation, applauding well after you’ve left the arena.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the streets outside, you find the rest of your sentinel party, looking much relieved.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, you did it, Rook. You got her back in one piece.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You wince as Lucian pats you on your badly injured shoulder.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I do hope everyone is in good spirits after that awful encounter.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t know about all that. Rookie’s injured. My gun needs repairs. And Viego got away with another fetter.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s just get back to headquarters. You’ve got a lot to catch up on.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You start to activate the Wayfinder, but Senna signals you to stop.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A weary Riven sits alone, countless troubles showing on her face.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hey there. So… where ya off to now?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Not sure. Can’t go back to Ionia. And I sure as hell can’t stay here.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Guess I’m a warrior without a home.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [All of the sentinels exchange knowing glances and nods.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Riven… what if I told ya you could have a home?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna, Riven, and you emerge from the catacombs into the depths of the Immortal Bastion.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well. This is it. The infamous Immortal Bastion. All of Noxus’s dark, dirty secrets can be found within these walls.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like the Mist has already found some of them.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna points to a heavy door at the end of the corridor. A dense cloud of Black Mist pools against the door, barely trickling in around its edges.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Through a parting in the Mist, you can see a symbol painted on the door—a black rose.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Sure enough. We’ve stumbled right up to the Black Rose’s doorstep.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: The question is, why would the Black Mist want to get in there?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Because whatever Viego is looking for is in that room. Too bad we’re going to find it first.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna attempts to open the door, but finds neither a handle nor a lock. She backs away, sensing something.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Seems to be sealed by some kind of enchantment.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [On closer inspection, she finds ancient Noxian letters engraved on the door.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: “Dark secrets bloom for those who share their own.”

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But I’ve got nothing better. Let’s tell the door our darkest secrets.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Okay. I think I’m done here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Clearly disturbed, Riven turns and begins to walk back toward the exit.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: We’re even now. Don’t get me wrong—you’re wonderful people. But I’m not sticking around for hokey riddles.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s her problem? Ah, well. Guess it’s up to us now.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And seeing how I’m an open book, maybe this is something for you to solve, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, go on. Tell this door a big, juicy secret.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Looking at the door, you plumb the depths of your memory for your darkest secret. One that you’ve never told anybody.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the door to the Black Rose vault begins to moan and creak…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven stops walking away and turns back in disbelief.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Don’t tell me that actually worked.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Way to go, Rookie. You might have a bright future as a sentinel…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...If I can forget about that awful secret you just shared.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Now be ready. We don’t know what’s in here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As soon as the three of you step through the doorway, you stop dead in your tracks.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The room is thick with Harrowing. You feel the same evil presence you felt in the mageseeker vault in Demacia.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s here. I can feel him.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Senna. I was hoping we’d meet again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Undaunted, Senna steps further into the room. You and Riven follow.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whatever you’re looking for, I’ve come to stop you from taking it.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah. You’re a little late for that.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A wine flagon? You came all the way here for that?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego smiles as the wine flagon sparkles with a mysterious magic.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As if in response, a tiny speck of that same magic begins to glow in Senna’s chest. She clasps her hands over it in fear.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No… I know that glow. It’s the same as the one in me. They’re all… all...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego reveals the handheld mirror from Demacia, and the ivory comb he took from the Freljord. They all sparkle in unison with the wine flagon, and the glow in Senna’s chest, as if they’re communicating.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego reveals the handheld mirror from Demacia. It sparkles in unison with the wine flagon, and Senna’s glow, as if they’re communicating.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Her fetters—pieces of her soul—scattered across the world.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Just like the piece that’s still in you.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: But I will reclaim them. I will make her whole again. I will restore my love, Isolde!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She was my friend. My protector. You want my piece of her? You’ll have to take it from my dead body.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You’re right. I can’t take her fetter from you. And I have tried.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: It is bound tightly to your soul. But you can give it to me willingly.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You sick, ego-driven bastard… This ends now!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Aren’t we in Noxus? Let’s settle this like Noxians! Fight me. TO THE END!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Alas, I regret to inform you that I have other matters to attend to.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: But if combat is what you seek, I know of another champion who just might oblige. Farewell.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As quickly as he appeared, Viego disappears into the Black Mist. You hear a familiar cackle coming from the doorway behind you.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: HaHA! Sounds like someone’s itching for a fight!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let us pass, Draven! I have to stop him!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Uh-uh-UHHH. You still owe me some fights, Lady Big Guns!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: So does your dirty traitor friend here.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Better not tell your buddies that. I’ve got ’em locked up, and if you ever wanna see ’em again… you gotta get through the best fighter in the arena!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I’m talkin’ about the greatest combatant of ALL TIME—THE RUINED PEOPLE’S CHAMPION… DRRRRAVENNN!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [sigh] Looks like we don’t have much choice.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nope. They’re masters of deception. Some say they’re the ones pulling all the strings in Noxus.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Then you don’t need me to tell you how dangerous they are.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Sure, kid. Let’s just say some people think the Black Rose are the ones who really run the Noxian Empire.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nope. They’re masters of deception. Some say they’re the ones pulling all the strings in Noxus.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: That doesn’t sound like the Black Rose. I think the flower thing is just a metaphor.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna fires her extremely large gun at the door...]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, if you try to interfere, I’ll blow your kneecaps off.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, if you try to interfere, I’ll blow your kneecaps off.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I didn’t ask for your opinion, Rookie.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Sentinel Headquarters. Far off the coast of Valoran.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Alone at your post, you watch the horizon for signs of trouble.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A battered schooner approaches, and lands on the shores of your island.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What’s happened to the headquarters? Place barely has a roof on it.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Where are all the other sentinels? Who’s your commanding officer?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You mean to tell me we sailed halfway across the ocean to recruit one damn sentinel?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You better be the best damn sentinel in history. How many years of experience do you have?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Are you kidding me? The kid’s a rookie?! Of all the rotten luck…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Listen, Rookie. Just over the horizon there is a cloud of evil bigger than anyone’s ever seen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A Harrowing that could end the world. In other words...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Stuff’s about to get real ugly.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So if you don’t want the world to die, I’m going to need you to dig deep and find some veteran skills in that rookie head of yours. Understand?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [At that moment, a distant cacophony of low rumbling and tormented shrieks sends chills down your spine.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look out over the ocean to see a massive cloud of Black Mist filling the sky, spreading toward you at a rapid pace.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Lock ‘n’ load, Rookie! You know how to shoot, right?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, ain’t that… perfect. I’m so glad we wasted all that time sailing here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No time for griping, Lucian. We’ve got a fight on our hands.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In an instant, a dark cloud of wraiths engulfs the beach.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: By pistol-whipping some of these wraiths with that busted gun of yours. Now, come on!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and your new sentinel friends must fight to survive.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Thank the gods. We’re in the right place.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Good. Not sure this boat would’ve made it much further.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I was going to say we need your help, but from the look of it, you don’t have much to give.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re sentinels. I’m Senna. He’s Lucian.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Though from the looks of it, I’d say you don’t have much to give.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Back at headquarters, the sentinels induct Olaf into their order.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...And may we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ...May we stand in the light, and smite the darkness with every bloodied axe we’ve got!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Felt like it needed something more.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Right. By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Olaf.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: YES! FIGHT BRAVELY! IN AN EPIC BATTLE THE SKALDS WILL SING OF FOR AGES!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: OH, I’LL REMEMBER THAT OATH SO WELL THAT—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Gwen will get you suited up.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: The pleasure is all mine! Come with me, Mr. Maniacal Screams.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Let's see if we can't find you some garments more fitting of a sentinel... Though I will miss your magnificent, smelly animal skins.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So, this is your plan? Find all the lunatics in the world, and give them our most closely guarded weapons?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What we're doing ain't exactly a mission for normal people. We need more sentinels.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And some of 'em are bound to be…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I reckon you could say that.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Attention, everyone! Your esteemed seamstress proudly presents: the newest, most well-fitted sentinel in all the land...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Not quite as supple as the fur of an ice yak, but it'll do nicely!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Now, when do I get to try out my new axes on some shadowy scourge?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It just so happens we're about to deploy again. Rest assured, there’ll be plenty more scourge left to fight.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: That's what I like to hear!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, if he decapitates one of us, I'm holding you responsible.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels arrive in the mageseeker vaults, determined to uncover Viego’s plot.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Here we are. The mageseeker vaults.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I figure whatever Viego is looking for is in the middle of this Black Mist cloud.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is it, sentinels. Into the darkness!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With the other sentinels at your side, you charge into the black core of Demacia’s Harrowing.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the center of the Mist cloud is a mageseeker chest, secured with a formidable lock.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. Looks like the Mist is trying to get into that chest.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh! Rookie, what kind of shimmering treasure do you think awaits us?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From out of the Black Mist cloud, a figure materializes.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah, sentinels. We meet again. In this, a prison for magic, no less.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Don’t they know true love cannot be sundered by lock or cage?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No… It’s him... Viego. (Mustn’t let him see us!)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen conjures her Hallowed Mist shroud, concealing herself from Viego.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What do you want from Demacia?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The locked chest opens. A handheld mirror levitates out of it…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and floats through the air to Viego’s hand.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What I have crossed the realms to rebuild.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You came back from the dead for some old mirror? Why?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He seems to be in the habit of taking things he thinks are his.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Why did you take her from me? She… She was my guide.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You speak as if you knew her.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She was as much a part of me as anything. You had no right...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You know nothing of my queen!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: There are many facets to her. Many parts of her persona, known to no one but me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He glances at the mirror in his hand. It glows with a pale, green light.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [A tiny spec of light begins to glow in Senna’s chest, flickering in unison with the glow of the mirror.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: With all of my strength, all of my love, I called to her, and drew her out!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Yet, a tiny piece of her remains. Lodged inside you, clinging...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s still there? Living in me? But… how?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: No matter. I will reclaim every last bit of my beloved queen.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego strains as he attempts to draw out the tiny piece of the queen that remains inside Senna.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Open fire! Let’s purify this creep!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels open fire on Viego as he pulls harder on the soul fragment, desperate to dislodge it.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: She holds fast. You WILL relinquish her!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Nooo! Leave her be, you villain!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen pulls Senna into her Hallowed Mist shroud, making her undetectable to Viego.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Where is she? I can’t feel her! What have you done with her?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hiding you in Hallowed Mist, of course.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But I have to stop him!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You there. New sentinel. You can perform a great service for the King of Camavor today…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: By telling me where your leader is hiding.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Insolence! You are but another enemy of our union. Another foe of our bliss. I will remember your face.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels unleash a hail of gunlight. Each shot chips away a small amount of Black Mist but does little to harm Viego.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You would deny me happiness? Lock it away, like the magics in this vault?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Then you will perish beneath its weight.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a blink, Viego disappears into the Black Mist, taking the mirror he retrieved from the vault.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A moment later, the building begins to shake violently.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t know! But we ain’t stickin’ around to find out.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good call, Rookie. Discretion is the right move here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe. But I still outrank you.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good call, Rookie. Discretion is the right move here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe. But I still outrank you.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Superb idea! I’ll find a heavy object for smashing!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stand down, Gwen. Not the time to go smashing magical boxes.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Aw. How else are we going to see what’s in it?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Stand still and take your smitin’, shadow beast!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Flee then! And lead me to your powerful, shadowy lord!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Huh. Now where do you suppose he ran off to?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: He got us out of the snow. Maybe we’d best leave him alone now.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah, let’s get back to the tasks at hand: finding Viego and stopping this Harrowing.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna is interrupted as the barbarian comes flying over the top of a nearby hill, landing at your feet.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The barbarian gets to his feet, collects his wits, and shouts at an unseen foe beyond the hill.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: HA-HAA! Is that all you’ve got?! I thought you’d be stronger!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A young, dreary yordle dressed in black appears on the hilltop.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: [SIGH] I told you—I’m not lord of anything. I’m just Vex, okay?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The yordle’s shadow unleashes a torrent of Black Mist that slams the barbarian into the face of a rocky cliff.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What’s going on here? This guy’s getting his face caved in and he’s excited about it?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Seen a lot of beatings in my time. Never seen anyone this excited to take one. What’s going on here?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You are the one! Today, I die a warrior’s death! Praise the Thousand-Pierced Bear!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a shrug and a sigh, Vex hurls a bolt of pure Black Mist, staggering the warrior briefly.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With another long sigh, she begins to cast a spell, going for the kill.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes… YES! DO IT, YA FUZZY SOOT STAIN!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, no! Mr. Furious Furs is in a most dreadful spot!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: We should help him. Any enemy of these Mist monsters is a friend of mine.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m inclined to agree. What do you say, Rook?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: When this guy’s berserker state wears off, he’ll be glad we saved him. Trust me.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ugh. Fine… I didn’t wanna do this fight anyway.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Come on, Shadow. We are so done with these people.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You okay, Olaf? It’s a good thing we showed up when we did.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Good thing? GOOD thing?! Do ya know what you’ve done?!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah, we just saved your hide. How about some gratitude?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Gratitude? You’ve doomed me to an inglorious end!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Do ya know how long I have searched for a foe powerful enough to end me?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: At last, I find one—a truly worthy opponent, capable of giving me the hero’s death I deserve.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: AND YOU JUST DENIED ME THAT RIGHT!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: And now I’m gonna give ya each an inglorious death of your own.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: You know, I’m beginning to think this fur-draped fellow is not as approachable as I’d hoped.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah, surprising. Normally, I get along well with other monster haters.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, I thought you said he was a good guy.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, hang on, Olaf. We spent a bunch’a time at sea together! You remember. We fought the Harrowing? You, me… Sarah Fortune showed up?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf rages toward the sentinels, swinging both axes in a berserker fury.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Okay, forget what I said about this guy. We’ve got two choices: Fight him, or let him chop us to pieces.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re sentinels. It’s our job to get involved in weird things.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Even if it’s an ornery barbarian in fur pants fightin’ a sad, magical… pixie thing.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Looks like that yordle is using Black Mist. That means she’s working with the Ruined King.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Now, please smack yourself for being so wrong, Rookie.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I’d do it myself, but my hands are frozen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s just the heat of battle.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: One of YOU? You... are not worthy opponents.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a grueling fight, you and the sentinels finally manage to bring down Shyvana.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s how you do it. Good shootin’, folks.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though still ruined, her strength is gone. You watch as she fades back into her human form.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne moves closer, squinting with mistrust at Shyvana.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne aims her loaded crossbow at Shyvana’s temple, point blank.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Agreed. She doesn’t look half as terrible now. I almost feel… pity for her.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Pity? Have you people lost your minds?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s a murderous fire-breathing hellbeast in front you. One minute ago, she was trying to roast you alive!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Take it from me, if you get these things down, it’s best to finish the job.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Shyvana didn’t know what she was doing. She’s under the influence of the Black Mist.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We can lock her in the mageseeker dungeon until she returns to normal.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What do you say, Rookie? You want to let this monster live?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, where’d Viego get off to?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I don’t see him. I do believe he’s… gone.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s get after him then. Rookie, fire up that Wayfinder and take us back to headquarters. We’ll plan our next move from there.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Suppose you find this guy? Then what?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You must’ve fired a hundred shots at him today, and barely made a dent.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You’ll die. Face it—you might know Harrowings, but I know monsters.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: And I know every one of them’s got a weak spot. Even this guy.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sounds to me like you’re volunteering.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Those fancy magical weapons you people use…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I think we can find something that’ll suit ya. Welcome aboard.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, are you sure about this? This woman seems a little… eager.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We need all the help we can get. Don’t you think so, Rookie?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good. Well, Vayne… welcome aboard. Are you sure you’re ready to be a sentinel?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Are you sure the sentinels are ready for me?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ready as we’ll ever be. (...I hope.)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Rookie activates the Wayfinder, and the entire party disappears in a flash of blinding white light.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Take it from me, kid. If you spare these beasts—they always come back to bite you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne glowers at you scornfully, with great disappointment.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You got a lot to learn, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You go around shooting everything, there won’t be any world to save.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take the dragon lady to the dungeon. She won’t harm anybody there.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You got a lot to learn, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You go around shooting everything, there won’t be any world to save.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take the dragon lady to the dungeon. She won’t harm anybody there.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ll keep her under control. No slappin’, I promise.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Don’t know if I can stop her from shootin’ you though.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m kiddin’, Rook. See? I can do jokes.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ll keep her under control. No slappin’, I promise.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Don’t know if I can stop her from shootin’ you though.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m kiddin’, Rook. See? I can do jokes.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Threatened by a massive Harrowing, the sentinels have taken refuge in the old headquarters.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: See there? We made it. Safe in the tidy confines of—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my. This place needs a lot of stitching.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s seen better days, for sure. Rookie, how are you stocked on supplies?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay. Looks like we’ll be roughing it tonight then. Everyone, find a spot on the floor and settle in.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Tomorrow, we fix the boat and try to rein in that Black Mist. ...Somehow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You move to your cot into the corner of the room...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [But your rest is interrupted by a startling sight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An old stone tablet in the back of the room begins to flicker with a magical glow…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [And an unfamiliar face appears, projected by magic.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: Hello? Headquarters, this is the Serpent Isles base. Can you hear me?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What the many hells is that?!

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: This is the Serpent Isles sentinel base. I’ve activated your communications portal.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: The situation is most dire. The Black Mist...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ve been dealing with it out here, too. How far has it spread?

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: We’ve been following its progress on the Worldstone...

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: In all my years, I’ve never seen a Harrowing like this. It moves quickly, with purpose, covering entire continents overnight.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: We’re holding our ground in the Serpent Isles, but... I can’t say how much longer we’ll last.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Where is the Ruined King? If I can just find him, I’ll snip him into so many pieces...

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I’m afraid it’s not that simple. Viego travels through the Mist in the blink of an eye, moving across the world at will.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: You must leave immediately and take the fight to his Black Mist. Your nearest region is Demacia. It’s as good a place to start as any.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Demacia? That’s a thousand leagues away! Even if we fix our boat, it’ll take months to—

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I see you know little of the secrets of our order. Touch Demacia on the Worldstone map.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian’s finger finds Demacia on the map. A beam of magical light shines from it, illuminating everyone in the room.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: This enchanted map can instantly transport you to any sentinel base in Runeterra.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: You must visit every region, cleanse them of Viego’s influence…

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: And if possible, recruit worthy soldiers to our cause.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hmm. Looks like we’ve got our work cut out for us. What do you say, Rookie? You ready to see the world?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know what? It doesn’t matter what Rookie thinks. The kid ain’t coming.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Come on, Lucian. You heard the sentinel. We need recruits.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Experienced recruits. We can’t be babysittin’ some greenhorn when we’ve got a world to save.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, Scissors over here... She’s earned it. Welcome aboard, Scissors.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Marvelous! I shall sew joy into every seam of this world! Viego will have no refuge!

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: There’s just one more thing you’ll need. Your headquarters should be equipped with a Wayfinder. It looks like this.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A holographic image of your gun appears on the tablet.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: It’s your ticket back to headquarters. You can activate it anywhere in the world, and it will teleport you home.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That looks like your gun, Rookie. I guess we know what it does now.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, you heard the man, Rook. Looks like I’m gonna need you to hand that Wayfinder over. You weren’t using it anyway.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I’m afraid that won’t work. The Wayfinder can only be used by the sentinel to whom it was bound.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And don’t get too comfortable. I got my eye on you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a flash of magical light, you and the sentinels are teleported from headquarters...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive in Demacia to find that little remains of the old sentinel base.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Beneath your feet is a sentinel glyph carved into the limestone landing. It glows softly on your arrival.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before you, the entire city of Demacia lies shrouded in Black Mist. The shrieks of wraiths and the cries of the living come from just inside the gates.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Damn. Guess the sentinel base is long gone.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Looks like there might not be much left of the city either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: At least, nothing that’s not ruined.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sorry, babe. Not the homecoming you were hoping for.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But first, we’ve got to get the lay of the land here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, where’s a good place to go to get some intelligence?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. There used to be an old tavern up here just inside the gates.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: A tavern? Really, Lucian. Isn’t it customary to toast after the battle?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Place was always full of salty ol’ sailors and mercenaries. If anyone can tell us anything about what’s happened around here, that’ll be the place to find ‘em.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s… not optimal. But it’ll have to do.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’ve had canned sturgeon. It’s not bad on crackers.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You messing with me, kid? Keep it up, and see where it gets ya.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s… not optimal. But it’ll have to do.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hell, I’d eat a sand snail. How bad could they be?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This ain’t the way to treat company, Rook.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The kid's having some fun at our expense.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sorry won’t get us anything, Rook.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The Mist doesn’t care how sorry you are. Neither does Viego.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: All they’re gonna understand is the light from a gun barrel.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’ll tell you what now. We go in guns blazing and purify this place.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stay close, Rookie. You’re about to earn your first stripe.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Look at you, all rarin’ to go.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t tease the kid, babe. I remember when my spirit wasn’t broken yet.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’ll see plenty of action soon enough, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...And may we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: ...May we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Riven.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight bravely, and remember your oath.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s wrong? Don’t tell me you wanna back out already.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Senna, I appreciate you doing this. I do, but…

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s been a long time since I’ve belonged somewhere. There are things about me—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I know. Back there at the Black Rose door… I could tell. You’ve got a past.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And that’s okay. Your present is here. With us.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I want to believe you. I really do.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With tears in her eyes, Riven leaves to get suited up in the weapon room.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So. You ever gonna tell me what happened back there with Viego?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Isolde, yes. All of those things he’s collecting... They’re her fetters. Bits of her soul.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s the only one he can’t touch. Unless I give it to him.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-huh. And why would he think you’d do that?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This… THIS is why I said you should stay away from him. You’re too important, and there’s a lot we don’t know here. Let the others do the fighting!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We are NOT having this discussion ag—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Attention, all sentinels! The great seamstress Gwen would now like to model her newest creation… SENTINEL RIVEN!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Wow. I… don’t know what to say.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I feel like a whole new Riven. Sentinel Riven. Yeah...

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Oh, no. You two look upset. Did I just interrupt something?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Talking about where to go next. You got any preference?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive in a cold, disorienting darkness.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Your feet can’t find the ground. It feels as if you’re suspended in ice.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I can’t feel my nose. What strange sensation is this?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’re just cold. I think we’re in a snow drift.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Guess this is where the sentinel base is. Or was.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Looks like we won’t find any sentinels here either. The place has been buried in decades of snowpack.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re a strange one, Scissors. I’ll tell you about it later.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, are you with me? Try to dig out of this. Go up.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’ll figure it out. You’re a bright kid.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a few minutes of frantic digging, you and the sentinels emerge in the forests of the ruined Freljord.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: First order of business is to find out what Viego wants here. Let’s spread out and search.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take one step and walk right into another deep snow drift.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ah, hells. This stuff is waist deep.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Amazing. What splendid fluffy whiteness. It’s like… freezing cotton!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh-huh. I’m glad you’re having fun playing in the snow, but we really need to find a way around it.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: A shovel would come in mighty handy right now.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, a formidable yell echos through the pines, raising the hair on your neck.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Come back here and taste the edge of my axe, ya ghoulish draugr!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: *GASP* What a peculiar, angry man. Is he wearing dead animals?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: He must possess a wealth of tailoring knowledge. Ooh, I must pick his brain.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hang on. I think I know this axe wielder.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Name’s Olaf. He’s a good guy...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...as long as you don’t piss him off.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crazed berserker attempts to chop down a wraith with his steel axes.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: He seems to hate wraiths. How bad can he be?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Not only that—look what he’s doing to this snow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in disbelief as Olaf hacks his way clean through the snow drifts, leaving a clear path for you.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This looks like an opportunity. I say we get behind this maniac and let him plow us out of here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Wonderful. I just know we’re going to become fast friends.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hello? Mr. Angry Animal Skins? Do wait for me!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now let’s get after that berserker.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Drop the sarcasm, Rook. We’re doing this.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels finish fighting through the sea of wraiths on the arena floor.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd roars in approval, thoroughly entertained by the action.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: YES! Ladies and gentlemen… WASN’T THAT VIOLENCE SPECTACULAR?!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Have you not enjoyed DRAVEN’S BIG SHOW?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Much to Draven’s satisfaction, the crowd begins to chant his name: “DRAVEN! DRAVEN! DRAVEN!”]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Listen to me, Draven! Everyone here is in a deep pile of trouble!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The Ruined King is here. We don’t know what he aims to do, but we need you to let us outta here so we can stop him.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: You’re my BIG STARS! My PRIZED COMBATANTS!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: The audience LOVES YOU! And therefore LOVES ME! I CAN’T let you leave.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In seconds, an army of ghostly Noxians pours through the arena gates, swarming the sentinels.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You resist at first, but there are far too many to overcome.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah. They’ve taken all our sewing tools. My crossbow’s gone, too.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I reckon we’ve been put in the gladiator pens.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: More like gladiator prison. These people are here against their will…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. The whole damn world’s about to be ruined, and we get to spend our final hours in gladiator jail.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: After everything we’ve been through, this is how it ends?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A woman’s voice speaks to you from the neighboring cell.]
Sounds to me like you’re looking to break out.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: They call me Riven. ...And other less flattering things.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I’ve been in here a while, and I think I’ve figured out an escape plan.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Can’t do it by myself though. I need a few people to make this work.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s either that or we fight each other in the arena tomorrow. What do ya say?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: First thing we need to do is get one of the arena guards in here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And how do we do that?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well… which one of you is the best liar?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’d be Rookie. Kid used to be a diplomat apparently.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...Or a con artist. I forget which.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Great. Sounds like we’ve got our liar.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Listen, kid. Somehow, I need you to get the guard to come to your cell. I don’t care how you do it.

speaker: Noxian Guard
dialogue: You’re awful mouthy for fresh meat. How ‘bout I shut yer gob for ya?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Tapping his truncheon in the palm of his hand, the guard enters your cell.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nice work. Keys are on his belt.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take the keys from the unconscious guard’s belt and open the cell door.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That was the big plan you’ve been devising? Hitting him over the head and taking his keys?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Now we just have to take out the other guards.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Other guards? How many are we talkin’?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, boy. Sure hope this filth bucket holds up.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Kid, the only thing on my mind... is how you’re going to manage to top today’s performance…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: WHEN YOU FIGHT IN MY ARENA AGAIN TOMORROW!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Kid, the only thing you’re going to be fighting…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: ...Is a fresh new challenger, WHEN YOU ENTER MY ARENA AGAIN TOMORROW!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You are giving orders to me?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a quick blur of violence, Vayne beats the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Nobody smacks our Rookie but me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What? But this man’s just a grunt. A decidedly unworthy foe.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a fit of berserker rage, Olaf beats the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels escape the mageseeker vault just in time to see it collapse behind them.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though you feel relieved, Senna seems angry at Gwen.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Why?! Why did you hide me in that mist shroud?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I was protecting you from him, Miss.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You were holding me back! I was meant to fight him!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No… I couldn’t let him see. We can’t let him take what’s left of her.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s left of “her?” You mean the Queen? The one whose spirit lives inside me?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: How do you know about her? What does that have to do with you?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Because of your interference, Viego got away.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s spread out, see if we can find his trail.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Maybe Gwen was right. If Viego wants what you’ve got, maybe it’s best if you stay hidden. Let us—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t even say it, Lucian. I’m doing this.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: There’s the monster! Viego’s heading down that street!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I see him! In that patch of Mist!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You turn to see Viego, darting toward the gates of the mageseeker compound.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: After him! Whatever he stole from the vault, we can’t let him leave with it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You pursue Viego through the courtyard, but he remains one step ahead, darting through the Mist clouds at incredible speed.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Just when you gain ground, Viego disappears again. A second later, he reappears in a patch of Mist, just outside the courtyard.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This ain’t working. He’s too fast in this Mist!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe I can cut off his path.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna fires her gun, taking out a large piece of the Black Mist, thwarting Viego’s exit.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There. Now he’s got nowhere to go!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [But just when you’ve got Viego cornered, you feel the heat of flames on the back of your neck...]

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: The benevolent King of Ruination… will shape this land for the better.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: And your kind will not prevail.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I don’t know about the rest of you, but I’ve had just about enough of the lizard lady.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne shoots a silver arrow from her crossbow, piercing Shyvana’s abdomen.]

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: So… You like fighting monsters, do you, Vayne?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh, Vayne? Did you forget to tell us she can turn into a dragon?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian and Senna both give you long, uncomfortable stares. Neither is happy with you, but neither is angry at you.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Last time I checked, I was the one who gives the orders, and you were the one fresh out of training.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So maybe start acting like it. Got me?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rook’s just looking out for you, darlin’.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Smart. You may be a rookie, but you’re a fast learner.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Thanks, Rook. Remember this when she ends up dead.
